passages.text: Model Update: Q2 Beat, **Q** **Y** Comps & EPS Guide Raised but 2H Caution remains

Q2 beat and FY guide was raised. Sales improved M/M in Q2, with comps flat in July and a good start in August. Yet, mgmt. was prudent with FY guide given the uncertain consumer elasticity response to industry price increases.PL expansion and value focus efforts are key drivers of the progress and appear well-timed for the co's core consumer in the current macro, although we believe further execution is warranted given the challenging environment. PT to $17.

**Q2 Results:** Net sales of $3.35B (-5.0% Y/Y) slightly beat $3.32B cons. Comps of -4.2% also beat -5.1% cons. Other rev of $199M (-3.9% Y/Y) was ahead of $181M cons. Op income was $161M,above $119M cons. Net, EPS of $0.56 beat $0.30 cons. GM% was +30bps Y/Y due to category mix,PL outperformance, and inventory mgmt. SG&A as % of rev was +30bps Y/Y on sales deleverage and -4.1% Y/Y, helped by lower store spending and a shift in credit expense to other revenue. OM% was 4.5%, +10bps Y/Y. Inventory was -5% Y/Y. Co expects inventory to be -MSD% Y/Y by year-end.

**Sales Trends & Consumer Health:** Sales trends improved throughout Q2, with flat comps in July driven by digital and PL sales. Overall PL was +500bps in Q2 vs. Q1, with July comps +LSD%.Mgmt described the consumer as more choiceful with discretionary spending, with lower to middle income customers most challenged, while higher income cohorts have been resilient. Consumers haven't felt the full impact of price increases, and co will monitor elasticity responses as higher price levels roll through in 2H. However, we believe co is well positioned to capture a more value-oriented consumer given its value-focus PL brands and more brand coupon eligibility.

**PL Update:** Mgmt placed a strong emphasis on rebalancing PL mix to re-engage its core customer,esp in women's, which overindexes to PL. The enhanced focus on the category appears well-timed as consumers exhibit an increased preference for value while also being more choiceful with discretionary spend. Co expects PL brands to increasingly contribute to topline through 2H, with the segment providing some tariff offset. Notably, every 100bps of PL penetration in PL = 10-15bps of GM%.

**Sephora Outperforms, But Continues to Moderate:** Sephora comps were flat in Q2, down from +1% in Q1,+13% in Q4, and+9% in Q3. Despite recent softness, the biz is still +LDD% on a 2YR stack and remains on track to hit the 5YR $2B target. Approx. 1/3 of Sephora customers shop across the full store, esp in junior and women's products.

**FY25 Guide Raised; EPS Above Street:** Guide was raised for comps at the low end to -4% to -5% from -4% to -5% and vs. -4.6% cons. GM% to expand ~30bps vs. prior guide of 30bps-50bps given focus on value. SG&A range updated to -4% to -4.5% from -3.5% to -5% previously. EPS raised to $0.5to $0.80, up from $0.10-$0.60 prior and vs. $0.44 cons. Mgmt. expressed caution in 2H given theUncertain consumer outlook and tariff dynamics, w/ offsets of PL mix, vendor negotiation, and sourcing optimization.
**Equity Research** **August 27,2025**

Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 5-10 of this report. * Jefferies LLC / Jefferies Research Services, LLC

KSS has a differentiated position as the active and casual off- mall destination among dept stores, but sales and margin trends have been challenged since the pandemic. Execution has been less consistent than we'd hoped, with inventories misaligned to sales, and KSS consumer has been pressured due to inflation. We believe the Sephora partnership is intriguing and could yield MT benefits, while improved merchandising initiatives underway are encouraging under new leadership, but we await further consistency and results before fully affecting our valuation.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- Comps -4% in FY25 as benefits from Sephora and merch initiatives are offset by consumer pressure and heavy promos, while comps in FY26 are -1% 
- GM% expands modestly in FY25 as inventory management, proprietary brand sales, and optimizing promotional offers offset tariffs 
- SG&A delivers 50bps in FY25 on lower sales and cost inflation 
- Price target: \(\) 17=5.4x\(2026E EV/EBITDA on\) \ \(1.07B\) . Our PT also represents 0.5x P/TBV

- Sales decline at a \(\sim 2 - 3\%\) CAGR next two years as comps recover modestly on PL initiatives 
- GM% increases steadily on improved inventory and promo management 
- New co-brand credit card rollout is successful 
- Less SG&A deleverage on additional cost reduction programs 
- OM% improves to \(3.0\%\) in FY26 but remains well below 7-8% MT target 
- Price target: \(\) 24=6.0x\(2026E EV/EBITDA on\) \ \(1.10B\)

- Sales decline at a \(\sim 5\%\) CAGR as new initiatives fail to gain traction, the co loses value consumer share to competition, and store closures 
- Credit card revs fall under pressure from macro 
- GM% improvements fall short and margins stagnate 
- SG&A cost actions help to protect margins, but not fully and OM declines to \(1.5\%\) including headwind from tariffs 
- Price target: \(\) 10=5.0x\(2026E EV/EBITDA on\) \ \(0.98B\)

Top Material Issues: 1) Energy Management: With a national retail footprint and large PL offering, Kohl's is in a unique position to make a positive impact on the planet through improved energy management. 2) Materials Sourcing & Efficiency: Kohl's is committed to increasing the sustainability of manufacturing its PL products, which are a large and important part of its business ( \(\sim 30\%\) of sales).

Company Targets: 1) Reduce combined scope 1 and scope 2 greenhouse gas emissions by \(50\%\) vs. 2014 baseline by 2025 ( \(19\%\) reduction as of 2022). 2) Reduce energy consumption by \(30\%\) at Kohl's facilities vs. a 2008 baseline by 2025 ( \(30\%\) complete as of 2022). 3) Require \(50\%\) of polyester styles to contain recycled materials in Kohl's proprietary brands by 2025 ( \(23\%\) do as of 2022).

Qs to Mgmt: 1) How do your energy management targets affect your LT financial framework? 2) How does focusing on more sustainable sourcing practices affect the operations of your PL business? 3) How do you plan for labor inflation and employee management in your margin targets?
ESG Sector Deep Dive: Retail

- Sales stabilize and begin to recover in 2025 
- Sephora value drives sales upside and accretes to bottomline 
- New brand launches drive traffic, conversion, and new customers 
- E-com initiatives improve growth and profitability

Model and PT Update: We model FY25 comps/EPS of \(3\% /\) 0.65 vs. \(- 4\% /\) 0.44 cons. For FY26, we model \(- 1.4\%\) comps, \(2.4\%\) OM% (- 20bps Y/Y) and \(0.39\) EPS. PT of \(\) 17\(= \sim 5.4x EV/EBITDA and\) 0.5x P/TBV.
Exhibit 1 - Quarterly and Annual Income Statement
Source: Company filings, Jefferies estimates

Based in Menomonee Falls, Wis., Kohl's is a family- focused, value- oriented specialty off- mall department store offering moderately priced, exclusive and national brand apparel, shoes, accessories, beauty and home products in an exciting shopping environment. The company operates over 1,100 stores in 49 states.
Our PT is based on a forward EV/EBITDA trading multiple. Key risks include Sephora execution, competition, and inventory management.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period. NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue

stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
Kohl's Corporation (KSS: \(16.17, HOLD)

Notes: Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company, made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company.
I: Initiating Coverage
